Quarterly Reports

Systematic analysis of technology terminology evolution, legal-technical alignment, and conceptual clustering. Published January, April, July, October.

Latest Report

State of AI Systems: Q1 2026

Published April 1, 2026

Our inaugural report documents 30+ critical legal-technical misalignments, tracks emergence of 50+ new concepts, and provides the first empirical mapping of AI terminology clustering patterns.

Key Findings

  • Critical Legal Gap: California SB 1047 definition of "algorithmic decision system" technically includes Excel spreadsheets
  • Emerging Concept: "Agentic AI" shows 400% quarterly usage increase with 7 competing definitions across domains
  • Clustering Pattern: "Reasoning" clusters more strongly with "Error correction" (0.76) than predicted by taxonomy
  • Translation Failure: "Safety" means institutional liability in deployment, universal harm prevention in public discourse — no overlap
Read Online Download PDF (2.3 MB)
1,247 downloads 8 academic citations 3 policy references

Report Structure

Each quarterly report follows a consistent format:

I. Legal-Technical Alignment

  • Critical misalignments in binding law
  • Emerging concerns in proposed legislation
  • Case law developments
  • International policy comparison
  • Recommendations for correction

II. Terminology Evolution

  • New concepts emerged this quarter
  • Shifting definitions
  • Deprecated terms
  • Adoption velocity metrics
  • Cross-domain translation patterns

III. Conceptual Clustering

  • Where concepts actually cluster
  • vs. imposed taxonomies
  • Unexpected neighborhoods
  • Co-occurrence analysis
  • Semantic drift patterns
